survey.question: How much did you enjoy the task?
How difficult was it to communicate with your partner?
How successful do you think you were at completing the task?
How difficult was it to understand your partner's instructions?
How likely is your partner to be a fluent speaker of English?
How likely is your partner to be a fluent speaker of Spanish?
How likely do you think it is that your partner is bilingual?
Please rate your partner according to the following attributes: friendly
Please rate your partner according to the following attributes: smart
Please rate your partner according to the following attributes: collaborative
Please rate your partner according to the following attributes: honest
Please rate your partner according to the following attributes: funny

If you were communicating with a chat bot, would you want them to communicate in both English and Spanish?

chat.msg: hi there, empezamos?
yes
alright, starting from the twig
should i head towards the tiger or another direction?
Yes towards the tiger straight to the parrot.
got it, i'm now at the parrot
where next, towards the frog or the elephant?
pass behind the parrot and turn left between the parrot and elephant.
okay, passing between the parrot and elephant
now i see rocks and a crocodile. which way should i go?
use the rocks to the frog
hopped the rocks, now i'm at frog island
good, now move pass the crocodile to the elephant and use the rocks to the giraffe
cool, passed the croc and now at elephant, heading to giraffe via rocks, ya estoy en el giraffe
Good, now move to the snake island
slithered over to snake island, ahora que?
There is our treasure.
alright, moving 2 steps east and
yes, aquí está our treasure! *finished*

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to go?
Yes I am.
awesome! so, we're starting by the white dog, right? give me a thumbs up if that's correct
Thumbs up
cool! okay, first thing, go a bit west, just below this wooden bench, and cross a trail until you nearly reach a florist stand
leave the florist stand for now, twirl 180 degrees left, and head back towards the lovely white dog. can you do that for me?
done
great job! now, pop over that branch southwards
you should hit another spot with a white dog chillin' by a checkered picnic mat. got it?
I am at the picnic mat.
nice! now, just stroll over the picnic mat, give a tap to the bowl of berries (but don't eat 'em!), and keep heading west
done
fantastic! see that wooden branch over there? use it to cross the river again, but this time head north
can you manage that?
Yep and i am there.
sweet! now, give that green bush a friendly dodge, go around it from the right side, you should hit the florist stand
can you see it?
yep
bravo! turn left now, scootch under the stand and head towards that big bridge with two folks biking on it
keep heading west past the bridge. got it?
yup
great! after the bridge, there's a bench with two old-timers reading newspapers
give them a friendly nod and then head south a bit
done
awesome! you should now be between the old folks and a wooden branch right next to a green bush
can you see it?
yes
perfect! now, squeeze east between the branch and the bush, alright?

chat.msg: hey!!! ya comenzamos?
yep
okay, i'm at the tent in the north
how should i go?
head down towards the dog
got it, i'm now next to the dog by the fire
where to next?
Good, turn left between the the dog and the fire then turn right between the fire and the mushroom.
alright, done
just passed the red mushroom. do i continue in this direction?
Nice, Now move ahead to the telescope
alrighty, i'm at the telescope now
what's next?
Good after passing the telescope turn right.
okay, turned right after the telescope
i see the house surrounded by rocks ahead
Good job, now head to the house.
easy peasy, i'm at the house now
*finished*

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to play?
Yep
great! start by heading southwest under the first palm tree. then, take a right at the second tree
before the third tree, make a sharp left, heading south. got it?
yep
fantastic! now, veer slightly to the left, then turn right, still heading south, but aim to pass left of the brown puppy
don't scare him off!
lol, I am there
awesome! now, go straight down between a tiny rock on your right and a big rock on your left
keep going until you hit water. you're doing great!
done
woohoo! now, wade into the water a bit. once you see a big red crab, turn right
follow along the big rock, moving towards the west. having fun yet?
yep, enjoying the water.
terrific! moving along, you'll pass a medium rock
once you spot a shark, make a sharp right. don't worry, it's friendly!
done
well done, brave soul! head back to land now, pass between the medium rock and a ball with blue, yellow and white stripes
continue north from there
done
good going! now, move slightly to the left, heading north-west
you'll spot a big speaker on your right and a red tent on your left
ok
fantastic! now, circle around the tent and head south towards the sea
I am in the sea.
hang on, buddy! don’t actually reach the water this time
just at the shore, turn right
ok
you should see a red kayak
go below it and proceed along its length. enjoying the game so far?

general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both your first and second languages?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?
What do you think when others mix languages in conversation? Please explain:
Any final comments about your language background?
